maml:description.maml:para: Gets an App Service plan.
The Get-AzureRmAppServicePlan cmdlet gets an Azure App Service plan in the specified resource group.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the App Service plan to get.
Specifies the name of the App Service plan to get.
Specifies the name of the App Service plan to get.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the App Service plan to get.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get an App Service plan

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the App Service plan named MyServicePlan in the resource group named Default-Web-WestUS.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a web app.
The Get-AzureRmWebApp cmdlet gets an Azure web app in the specified resource group.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app.
Specifies the name of the web app to get.
Specifies the slot name of the web app.
Specifies the name of the web app to get.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app.
Specifies the slot name of the web app.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets web app named MyWebApp for the slot named dev in the resource group named Default-Web-WestUS.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an App Service plan.
The New-AzureRmAppServicePlan cmdlet creates an Azure App Service plan in a specified geo location with the specified SKU, worker size, and number of workers.
Specifies the name of the resource group to contain the App Service plan.
Specifies the name of the App Service plan to create.
Specifies the geo location for the App Service plan.
Specifies the SKU of the App Service plan to create.
Specifies the number of workers to allocate.
Specifies the size of the workers.
Specifies the geo location for the App Service plan.
Specifies the name of the App Service plan to create.
Specifies the number of workers to allocate.
Specifies the name of the resource group to contain the App Service plan.
Specifies the SKU of the App Service plan to create.
Specifies the size of the workers.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create an App Service plan

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates an App Service plan named MyServicePlan in the geo location West US. The command specifies a Basic SKU and allocates two workers.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a web app.
The New-AzureRmWebApp creates an Azure web app in a specified resource group using the specified App Service plan and data center.
Specifies the name of the resource group to contain the web app.
Specifies the name of the web app.
Specifies the slot name of the web app.
Specifies the data center location.
Specifies the App Service plan for the web app.
Specifies the App Service plan for the web app.
Specifies the data center location.
Specifies the name of the web app.
Specifies the name of the resource group to contain the web app.
Specifies the slot name of the web app.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates an Azure web app named MyFirstSite in the specified resource group and data center, with the existing App Service plan MyAppServicePlan.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an App Service plan.
The Remove-AzureRmAppServicePlan cmdlet removes an Azure App Service plan.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the App Service plan to remove.
Specifies the name of the App Service plan to remove.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the App Service plan to remove.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the App Service plan to remove.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove an App Service plan

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the Azure App Service plan named MyAppServicePlan in the resource group named Default-Web-WestUS.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a web app.
The Remove-AzureRmWebApp cmdlet removes an Azure web app in a specified resource group. The operation removes all slots and metrics by default.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app.
Specifies the name of the web app to remove.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the web app to remove.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the Azure web app named MySite in the resource group named Default-Web-WestUS.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops and starts a web app.
The Restart-AzureRmWebApp cmdlet stops and then starts an Azure web app.
If a web app is already in a stopped state, use the Start-AzureRMWebApp command to start the web app.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app.
Specifies the name of the web app to restart.
Specifies the slot name of the web app.
Specifies the name of the web app to restart.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app.
Specifies the slot name of the web app.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops the site named MyFirstSite and then restarts it.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an App Service plan.
The Set-AzureRMAppServicePlan cmdlet modifes an Azure App Service plan.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the App Service plan to modify.
Specifies the name of the App Service plan to modify.
Specifies the geo location for the App Service plan.
Specifies the SKU of the App Service plan to modify.
Specifies the number of workers to allocate.

Specifies the size of the workers. Valid values are:
-- Small -- Medium -- Large
Specifies the geo location for the App Service plan.
Specifies the name of the App Service plan to modify.
Specifies the number of workers to allocate.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the App Service plan to modify.
Specifies the SKU of the App Service plan to modify.

Specifies the size of the workers. Valid values are:
-- Small -- Medium -- Large
Starts a web app.
The Start-AzureRmWebApp cmdlet starts an Azure web app.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app to start.
Specifies the name of the web app to start.
Specifies the slot name of the web app.
Specifies the name of the web app to start.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app to start.
Specifies the slot name of the web app.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts the web app named MyWebApp in the resource group named Default-Web-WestUS.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops a web app.
The Stop-AzureRmWebApp cmdlet stops an Azure web app.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app.
Specifies the name of the web app to stop.
Specifies the slot name of the web app to stop.
Specifies the name of the web app to stop.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the web app.
Specifies the slot name of the web app to stop.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops the web app named MyWebApp in the resource group named Default-Web-WestUS.
